questions.text: Gland around pigmented area is:
Following clinical situation occurs due to:

options.label: A
options.text: Fibrosis of suspensory ligaments of cooper

questions.correct_answer: A. Fibrosis of suspensory ligaments of cooper
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Fibrosis of suspensory ligaments of cooper

questions.text: A patient visited with following presentation. Which muscles are paralysed:

A 50-year male Jagan, was presented with severe headache and vomiting and history of immediate unconsciousness immediately. On admission he was found hypertensive and history of poorly controlled hypertension also found. Gradual decline in neurological functions was present. Neck stiffness, Kernig’s sign was also found positive. NCCT was done but it failed to make a diagnosis. Then LP was performed in which CSF was found grossly bloody with RBC counts upto 1 million/cu mm. After 48 hours of clinical manifestations xanthochromic spinal fluid was found. What is your single best diagnosis?

A 35 years old alcoholic and chronic smoker male Amit, was having the history of hypercholesterolemia for 8 years. He presented at OPD with hemiplegia on right side of body. On examination he was having loss of proprioception, fine touch and vibration sensations on right side. He was also unable to recognize the objects with closed eyes from right hand. On examination left side of the tongue was atrophied and deviation on left side during protrusion was found. On cerebral angiography there was blockage of artery located in median fissure of spinal cord at lower part of brain stem was found. What is your diagnosis?
Which nerve is cut in Vidian’s Neurectomy?
In given MRI image identify the marked structure?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Arbor Vitae

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Arbor Vitae is the tree-like white matter structure within the cerebellum responsible for motor coordination and balance.
  • ➤ Arbor Vitae

questions.text: During orthopaedic surgery tendon was required in lower limb. Which muscle is used for tendon grafting operation in lower limb surgery?
A patient age 45 presented with difficulty in foot eversion and sensory loss on the lateral leg & dorsum of foot. The nerve injured is?

A 67 year old lady Janki, presented with loss of subconscious kinaesthetic sensation, loss of pain and temperature sensation as well as loss of crude touch from body. On examination fine touch sensation was found normal. In case of spinal angiography blockage of which of the following artery might be seen?

A 40 years old female Vimla, presented with road traffic accident with brief loss of consciousness. Fatigue, pallor and weakness on general examination. She was also having mild jaundice and gall stones. Massive hepatosplenomegaly with hypersplenism was also found. On skull radiography widening of diploic spaces was found. On previous history she was reported to had failure to thrive in early childhood, growth retardation, delayed puberty. Other findings are leg ulcer and skin bronzing. After the RTA she is having headache and also presenting with lucid interval, nausea, vomiting focal neurological deficits. On plain X ray skull fracture is visible and on CT scan hyperdense biconvex opacity is visible on temporal region. What is your single best diagnosis for current presentation?

A patient Ramlal, 56 years old male, presented with history of palanaesthesia, astereognosis, loss of proprioception and fine touch sensation. He has chronic history of smoking, diabetes and hypertension. In case of spinal angiography blockage of which of the following artery might be seen:
In adults, lumbar puncture is done at?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) L3-L4

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In adults, lumbar puncture is most commonly performed at the L3-L4 interspace , ensuring safety by accessing the lumbar cistern below the termination of the spinal cord.
  • ➤ L3-L4 interspace

questions.text: A 45 years old alcoholic and chronic smoker male was having the history of hypercholesterolemia for 12 years. He presented at OPD with hemiplegia on right side of body. Also tremor, hypokinesia and rigidity was found on same side of body. On examination drooping eyelid and fixed wide pupil pointed down and out leading to diplopia found. On cerebral angiography occlusion of paramedian branches of posterior cerebral artery was found. What is your diagnosis?
Handle bar palsy occurs due to compression of which nerve?
On ENT examination tympanic membrane was seen as given image. Identify the marked structure?
Blockage of artery supplying to indicate area will cause all except?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Ataxia

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Blockage of the anterior cerebral artery supplying the paracentral lobule can cause rectal and urinary incontinence and perianal anesthesia, but ataxia is not associated with this lesion .
  • ➤ paracentral lobule
  • ➤ ataxia is not associated with this lesion

questions.text: A patient is unable to hold the paper between his 4 th & 5 th fingers. He is also unable to flex distalInterphalenges of same fingers. These symptoms are likely to be damaged at which of the following site in given humerus image?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) D

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Damage to the ulnar nerve at the medial epicondyle (site D) causes an inability to hold paper between the 4th and 5th fingers and loss of flexion at the distal interphalangeal joints of these fingers.
  • ➤ ulnar nerve at the medial epicondyle (site D)

questions.text: Superior, inferior & facial colliculus are indicated respectively as?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) B, C, D

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The superior colliculus , inferior colliculus , and facial colliculus are indicated as B, C, and D , respectively, and are critical landmarks in the midbrain and brainstem.
  • ➤ superior colliculus
  • ➤ inferior colliculus
  • ➤ facial colliculus
  • ➤ B, C, and D

questions.text: Identify the correct options with indicated structures?

options.label: A
options.text: A-anterior cerebral artery, B-ICA, C-infundibulum, D-Posterior communicating artery, E-III nerve, F-IV nerve

options.label: B
options.text: A-anterior communicating artery, B-ICA, C-Infundibulum, D-posterior communicating artery, E-III nerve, F- IV nerve

options.label: C
options.text: A-anterior cerebral artery, B-ICA, C-Infundibulum, D-posterior communicating artery, E-IV nerve, F- V nerve

options.label: D
options.text: A-anterior communicating artery, B-ICA, C-Infundibulum, D-posterior communicating artery, E-III nerve, F- V nerve

questions.correct_answer: B. A-anterior communicating artery, B-ICA, C-Infundibulum, D-posterior communicating artery, E-III nerve, F- IV nerve
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) A-anterior communicating artery, B-ICA, C-Infundibulum, D-posterior communicating artery, E-III nerve, F- IV nerve

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Circle of Willis consists of the anterior communicating artery, internal carotid artery, posterior communicating artery, and other contributing arteries. Cranial nerve III and IV are also found in proximity to this structure.
  • ➤ Circle of Willis

questions.text: One chronic alcoholic patient was diagnosed with rheumatoid arthritis. His presented with following clinical condition: What is your diagnosis?

For syringomyelia which of the following statement is false:

options.label: A
options.text: It is related with Dissociative anaesthesia

options.label: B
options.text: Loss of pain and temperature sensations but crude and fine touch sensations remain normal

options.label: C
options.text: Loss of pain, temperature and crude touch sensations and fine touch sensation remains normal

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: C. Loss of pain, temperature and crude touch sensations and fine touch sensation remains normal
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Loss of pain, temperature and crude touch sensations and fine touch sensation remains normal

questions.text: Tracts are defined as bundle of axons with similar:

options.label: B
